intro: Pseudolysimachion kiusianum, commonly known as the Kiusianum bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
